articles.title: Greetings to President of Mauritius
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Mauritius
 Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greeting to Anerood Jugnauth, president of Mauritius, on the 44th anniversary of its independence and the 20th anniversary of the proclamation of its Republic.
					 Kim in the message wished the president and people of Mauritius success in their work for the stability and development of the country and expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would steadily grow stronger.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun N-S Ties Can Not Become Plaything of Confrontation-minded Maniacs
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun N-S Ties Can Not Become Plaything of Confrontation-minded Maniacs
 Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- The north-south relations have hit the lowest ebb for the first time in history due to the hideous provocation of confrontation-minded maniacs including traitor Lee Myung Bak who defamed the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, says Rodong Sinmun in a bylined article Sunday.
					 The north-south relations have plunged to complete deadlock due to the group of traitors' treacherous and anti-reunification acts that war may break out any time, the article says, and go on:
					
					 Dialogue and cooperation between the north and the south of Korea are the best way for removing the danger of the war from the Korean Peninsula and achieving the independent reunification, peace and prosperity through the national reconciliation and unity.
					
					 However, the Lee group has escalated the confrontation, regarding the compatriots as an object that it can not get reconciled and united.
					
					 The Lee group is made up of confrontation-minded maniacs who spoke ill of the north-south joint declarations and the idea of "By our nation itself" which all the Koreans unanimously support as the reunification program of the new century. It is also the chieftain who stroke down all the achievements the compatriots have made with patriotic enthusiasm.
					
					 The puppet military warmongers have taken the lead in making desperate efforts to realize the traitor Lee's policy of escalating the confrontation.
					
					 War maniacs hell bent on igniting a war against the north let loose a spate of bellicose assertion such as "preemptive attack against the north" and constantly waged all kinds of joint military drills including Key Resolve, Foal Eagle and Ulji Freedom Guardian, escalating the tension on the Korean Peninsula to an extreme phase.
					
					 The north-south relations on which hinges the destiny of the nation and the future of the reunification can not become a plaything of the south Korean ruling quarters' policy of confrontation with the north.
					
					 It is imperative to force the Lee group to pay a price for treacherous and anti-reunification crimes in order to pull the north-south relations from the worst catastrophic phase and vigorously promote the trend of the June 15 era of reunification.
					
					 Those who hurt the social system and dignity of the DPRK will never be able to survive in this land.

articles.title: Unhasu Orchestra of DPRK Arrives in France
articles.content:
Unhasu Orchestra of DPRK Arrives in France
 Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- The Unhasu Orchestra led by Kwon Hyok Bong, advisor to the Korean Traditional Music Institute, arrived in Paris on Sunday to co-perform with Radio Philharmonic Orchestra of France.
					 It was greeted at the airport by the general director of the Radio Broadcasting of France, officials concerned and staff members of the DPRK mission in Paris.

articles.title: DPRK Men's Soccer Team Beats Tajikistan Team 2:0
articles.content:
DPRK Men's Soccer Team Beats Tajikistan Team 2:0
 Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- The DPRK men's soccer team beat the Tajikistan rival 2:0 on Sunday at the 2012 AFC Challenger Cup Tournament held in Nepal.
					 The DPRK team will have the third match with the Indian rival on March 13.

articles.title: Koreans in U.S. Label Lee Myung Bak as Pro-American Traitor
articles.content:
Koreans in U.S. Label Lee Myung Bak as Pro-American Traitor
 Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. issued a commentary on March 8 in which it condemned the south Korean puppet group of traitors for pressing for the naval base construction on Jeju island.
					 The commentary accused the south Korean authorities of finally deciding to blast the rare natural rock on the island to push ahead with the construction.
					
					 A large number of people from all walks of life in south Korea strongly protest the construction, branding it as very dangerous one escalating the tension on the Korean Peninsula and bringing a war.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak "government" deserves punishment because it has pushed ahead with the base construction even causing the environmental degradation, the commentary said.
					
					 Saying that Lee is contemplating offering the base to the U.S., the commentary noted that if it does so, the Jeju Island will turn into barren land at the hands of the U.S. forces, and peace be wantonly harassed.
					
					 Lee Myung Bak is, indeed, a pro-American traitor who lives his life only for the interests of the U.S., it charged, warning that the Lee's regime is sure to stand punishment by the people as it has turned its back on the people till the last period of its term of office.

articles.title: Koreans' Resentment Is Natural: Japanese Organizations
articles.content:
Koreans' Resentment Is Natural: Japanese Organizations
 Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- Friendship and solidarity organizations of Japan on March 6 issued statements denouncing the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors for slandering and insulting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, the U.S. and south Korea for staging the joint military exercises and the Japanese authorities for cracking down on organizations under the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon).
					 The Kyoto Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea said that it was very natural for the DPRK to issue a warning with towering resentment against the south Korean authorities who hurt the dignity of its supreme leadership at a time when the military tension was running high due to the U.S.-south Korea large-scale joint military exercises.
					
					 It demanded the south Korean authorities stop at once the provocative joint military exercises with the U.S. and formally apologize to the DPRK.
					
					 The Nagano Prefectural People's Council for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea noted that the south Korean authorities' acts of hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK clearly shows who is the wrecker of the peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 It demanded the south Korean authorities stop at once the said acts.
					
					The Tokushima Prefectural Citizens' Forum for Japan-Korea Friendship said that the Japanese government should stop the hostile acts against the DPRK, opt for dialogue and negotiations with sincerity and work hard to open diplomatic relations between the two countries.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Apologize to Korean People and World Peace-loving People: Foreigners
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Apologize to Korean People and World Peace-loving People: Foreigners
 Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- Foreign figures in their statements denounced the south Korean authorities for committing high treason of dare hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK while driving the situation in the Korean Peninsula to the brink of war through the large scale joint military exercises in league with the U.S. 
					 Ali Houdou, president of the Socialist Party of Benin, on March 4, branded the provocative acts of the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors who dared hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK as an unpardonable and blatant challenge to it. He urged the Lee Myung Bak group to immediately stop the reckless moves for confrontation and apologize to the Korean people and the world peace-loving people.
					
					 Vishwanath, director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, on March 6 said that the army and people of the DPRK are trembling with towering resentment against the Lee group. He fully supported the firm stand of the DPRK to wage indiscriminate sacred war including physical strikes.
					
					 That day Ristiyanto, secretary general of the National Guidance Council of the Pioneer Party of Indonesia and chairman of the Indonesia-Korea Association for Friendship and Cultural Exchange, denounced the reckless acts of the south Korean authorities who hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK as treacherous acts and serious provocations leading the situation to an uncontrollable phase.
					
					 Hessou Kohovi, chairman of the Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader" and chairman of the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and of General Kim Jong Il's Works, on the same day said that the great men of Mt. Paektu, whom not only the Korean people but the progressive mankind are praising and revering, represent the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and the whole world, adding that so the whole world is trembling with indignation.

articles.title: Japanese Personages Slam Lee Myung Bak Group's Anti-DPRK Smear Campaign
articles.content:
Japanese Personages Slam Lee Myung Bak Group's Anti-DPRK Smear Campaign 
 Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- Japanese personages released statements on March 6 in denunciation of the hideous provocations by the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors.
					 Takao Kamakura, chairman of the Saitama Prefectural Council for Japan-Korea Friendship and Solidarity, denounced the group for holding the big-scale joint military exercises in collusion with the U.S. in a vicious way, and perpetrating such thrice-cursed act as defaming the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					
					 It said that the puppet group's reckless moves to invade the DPRK are the last-ditch efforts of those finding themselves in the miserable plight. It urged them to apologize to the DPRK for their thrice-cursed act.
					
					 Mitsihiro Sasaki, secretary of the secretariat of Kyoto of the solidarity of broad sections of people for independence, peace and democracy in Japan, said that the act of debasing the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK is unpardonable.
					
					 He noted that though the Lee "government" is rubbing salt into the wounds of the Korean people who are stricken with big grief over the great loss to the nation, and trying to prolong their remaining days, they are coming under increasing fire by not only the south Koreans but also other people of the world.
					
					 He said that the south Korean puppet Intelligence Service is committing the massive anti-DPRK smear campaign in collusion with Japanese mass media.

articles.title: S. Korean Female Workers Urge Authorities to Ensure Their Right
articles.content:
S. Korean Female Workers Urge Authorities to Ensure Their Right
 Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- The Confederation of Trade Unions and female workers of trade unions under it held a rally at the plaza of the Seoul Railway Station on March 8, calling for equal right of women.
					 Speakers at the meeting recalled that female workers of south Korea are now suffering the fear of unemployment, being subject to the most serious discrimination in the world.
					
					 Women are living in contempt and humiliation, they deplored, adding the women receive lower wages for the same work done as men and are not granted even a right to bring up their children.
					
					 What is more serious is that female workers are increasingly assaulted at their work sites, they charged.
					
					 A resolution was read out at the meeting.
					
					 Women are compelled to turn out against the authorities' unjust policy of discrimination against the women, it said.
					
					 Then they held demonstration march.

articles.title: S. Korean Prosecutor Accused of Arresting Employee who Praised DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Prosecutor Accused of Arresting Employee who Praised DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- The puppet Pusan District Prosecutor's Office put into custody an employee of the Pusan Military Service Agency on charges of violating the notorious "Security Law" on March 7.
					 The fascist prosecutor took such an action for the mere reason that the employee posted on Internet website an article praising the Juche idea and the DPRK.

articles.title: China Puts Efforts to Highway Construction
articles.content:
China Puts Efforts to Highway Construction
 Beijing, March 10 (KCNA) -- China puts efforts to paving highway in Sichuan Province.
					 Highway extending 3 387 km has been paved since 2008.
					
					 The province plans 6,350 km by 2015.

articles.title: World Yearns for New Order: Iranian President
articles.content:
World Yearns for New Order: Iranian President
 Tehran, March 10 (KCNA) -- President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad said the world is now yearning for a new global order.
					 Iranians have never been after dominating other nations, he said, adding the Iranian nation is one of the few nations in the world which could offer a new order based on sublime human theories to revive justice, human dignity and truth.
					
					 He made the remark in a meeting on March 7.

articles.title: U.S. Has Many Weak Points Despite Its Power Show-off: Iranian Official
articles.content:
U.S. Has Many Weak Points Despite Its Power Show-off: Iranian Official 
 Tehran, March 10 (KCNA) -- Secretary of the Supreme National Security Council Saeed Jalili on Wednesday said the U.S. has many weak points despite its power show-off.
					 He made the remarks in a meeting with a vice president of Iraq. 
					
					 He said America's fragile position in Iraq is an instance of its weakness while Iraq is making progress thanks to its internal unity and solidarity.
					
					 While the potentials of Iran and Iraq are on the rise, arrogant powers are on the decline and this heralds a bright future for regional nations, he added.

articles.title: Cuba Calls for Global Efforts for Solving Food Problem
articles.content:
Cuba Calls for Global Efforts for Solving Food Problem
 Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- A representative of Cuba, speaking at a meeting of the United Nations Human Rights Council held in Geneva on March 6, called for global cooperation and solidarity in the efforts to eradicate starvation.
					 Noting food price is on the steady rise and the agricultural products are not equally distributed worldwide, the representative said it is important to establish a fair and democratic international order to tackle the problem.
					
					 Starvation is a serious problem as it is not only limited to the Horn of Africa but affects over 80 developing countries, the representative noted.

articles.title: U.S. Tries to Turn Philippine Island to Naval Base
articles.content:
U.S. Tries to Turn Philippine Island to Naval Base 
 Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- Philippine seafarers on Thursday accused the United States of taking advantage of upcoming joint military exercises to build a naval base on the island of Palawan, in the west of the archipelago.
					 The vice president of the Association of Pamalakaya Fishermen, Salvador France, told local media that the Pentagon wants its 6,000 soldiers to familiarize with the field to turn Palawan into a military base.
					
					 France said that the White House claims that the Philippines will become the new Okinawa.

articles.title: Severe Storms Hit Italy's Sicily Island
articles.content:
Severe Storms Hit Italy's Sicily Island 
 Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- A severe storms have hit Italy's Sicily Island, disrupting local transport and damaging unharvested crops, the ANSA news agency reported on Thursday.
					 The international airport stayed closed on Wednesday night and railways and highways on the island were also disrupted by landslides.
					
					 Some 40 people were forced to be evacuated from their homes. A hail storm also severely damaged fruits and vegetables before they were harvested.

articles.title: Unemployment Increases in U.S.
articles.content:
Unemployment Increases in U.S.
 Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- Unemployment increases in the U.S. due to the economic financial crisis.
					 The U.S. Labor Department said that the advance figure for seasonally adjusted initial claims for jobless benefits was 362,000 in the week ending March 3, an increase of 8,000 from the previous week's revised figure.

articles.title: Shooting in U.S. Hospital Kills Two, Wounds Seven
articles.content:
Shooting in U.S. Hospital Kills Two, Wounds Seven
 Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- Shooting crimes are constant occurrence in the U.S., which spark great social concerns and fear.
					 A mass shooting on Thursday at Western Psychiatric Institute and Clinic in Pittsburgh, U.S. state of Pennsylvania, has killed two people and wounded seven others.
					
					 Series of shootings are a clear proof of the U.S. as a crime-plagued country.

articles.title: Japan Bankruptcies Rise
articles.content:
Japan Bankruptcies Rise 
 Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- The number of corporate bankruptcies in Japan in February increased 5.1 percent from a year earlier to 1,038 for the first rise in three months, a credit research agency said Thursday.
					 Liabilities left by the bankrupt companies soared 53.8 percent to 631.26 billion yen.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Laying off Workers
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Laying off Workers
 Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- Organizations of people of different strata including the Ssangyong Motors trade union held a rally in Seoul on March 8 at which they denounced the puppet group for turning its face away from ensuring the workers' right to existence.
					 Speakers at the rally said that many unemployed workers of the Ssangyong motorcar factory and their families are now in difficulties.
					
					 The authorities, however, are shamelessly shielding the dismissal step without even a word of apology and still refuse to take measures, they charged.
					
					 Saying that they can not repress their resentment at the attitude of "government", they renewed their stand to take actions against Chongwadae and "National Assembly" through the solidarity with various civic and public organizations.
					
					 They expressed their will to wage more dynamic action in demand of the settlement of the lay-off issue and the abolition of evil law against labor.

articles.title: Solution to Issue of Comfort Women Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Solution to Issue of Comfort Women Urged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- Members of women's organizations including the Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps in south Korea and victims to sexual slavery for Japanese army held a press conference in Seoul on March 8 demanding the Japanese government make an apology and reparation for the crimes of sexual slavery in the past.
					 Speakers at the conference disclosed the fact that during the period of colonial rule by the Japanese imperialists, Korean women were forced into sexual slavery at the battle-sites of Japanese army.
					
					 It is very regretful that the issue of "comfort women" has not yet been settled, they added.
					
					 They urged the Japanese government to apologize and redeem for the past crimes as soon as possible.
					
					 They underscored their will to wage positive actions to secure apology and reparation from the Japanese government.

articles.title: Work Carried in Bulletin of Latin American Institute of the Juche Idea
articles.content:
Work Carried in Bulletin of Latin American Institute of the Juche Idea
 Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- The gist of general secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Juche Philosophy Is an Original Revolutionary Philosophy" was carried in bulletin No. 3 of the Latin American Institute of the Juche Idea. 
					 The work, published on July 26, Juche 85 (1996), clarifies the idea that the Juche philosophy is an original philosophy that has its intrinsic principles in a systematic way, and a revolutionary and popular philosophy truly serving the popular masses in the struggle for independence.

articles.title: Birth Anniversary Commemorated by Bulgarian Paper
articles.content:
Birth Anniversary Commemorated by Bulgarian Paper
 Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- The February issue of the Bulgarian paper Iskra carried a special write-up on the birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 It carried articles titled "42 and Mt. Paektu", "Mt. Paektu knows who its master is", "Songun brilliant commander" and "Immortal works" under the bannerline "Kim Jong Il, son of Mt. Paektu". It also carried his portrait.
					
					 The paper went on:
					
					 Mt. Paektu where Kim Jong Il was born is situated on 42 degrees North Latitude. This is same with 1942, a year he was born.
					
					 Mt. Paektu has so many stories of profound meaning.
					
					 Kim Jong Il resembles Mt. Paektu in the true sense of the word. 
					
					 The paper told a story about the mysterious natural phenomenon on Mt. Paektu at a time when he climbed it one year.
					
					 Kim Jong Il, leader of the DPRK, is a man with extraordinary stratagem and matchless grit, it said, stressing that he started the Songun revolutionary leadership by visiting Seoul Ryu Kyong Su 105 Guards Tank Division of the Korean People's Army on August 25, 1960, and pursued the Songun politics from the late 1960s.
					
					 He published treatise "On the Juche Idea" on March 31, 1982, it noted, adding this work is an immortal work which comprehensively deals with the Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung.
